node.title: Latest on COVID from around the world: Global cases approach 250 million
node.content: ["Worldwide cases of COVID-19 are approaching 250 million as the surge from the Delta variant eases and more normal trade and tourism resume, although some countries in eastern Europe are experiencing record outbreaks.\n", "Over the past three months, the daily average number of cases has fallen by 36 percent, according to a Reuters analysis.", "Even though the spread has slowed, the virus is still infecting 50 million people every 90 days due to the highly transmissible Delta variant, the analysis showed. It took nearly a year to record the first 50 million COVID cases.", "Here's the latest on the pandemic from around the world."]
